meta.notes: Values normalized to area; galley/ECLSS also list equipment for more exact billing when counts are known.

sources.cq_electronics_2009: Ullrich et al., Assessment of the Crew Quarter on the ISS Node 2 (NASA/2009) – ~153 W electronics waste heat per CQ.
sources.bvad_2023_food: NASA Baseline Values and Assumptions Document (BVAD v3.x), Tables 4.3.2–4.3.3 – refrigeration/freezer power 0.048–0.268 kW.
sources.ispr_dims_esa: ESA ISS User Guide – ISPR footprint 1.044 m × 0.882 m (~0.921 m²).
sources.oga_ices2019: ICES 2019 paper on ISS OGA – OGA rack power capability ~3.8–4.0 kW.
sources.shuttle_food_1974: Shuttle Food System (1974) – microwave oven ~1.8 kW (example of peak galley appliance).

sleep.basis: 153 W electronics heat per CQ / 3.0 m² default area

galley.basis: BVAD refrigerator/freezer power normalized by ISPR footprint (0.921 m²)

equipment.name: Microwave / Food Warmer
equipment.note: Short bursts; include only if present.

dining.basis: lighting + fans only; no fixed appliances

hygiene.basis: lighting, fans; heaters/pumps added as explicit equipment if modeled

exercise.basis: fans/vacuum/pads; large devices should be modeled as equipment

medical.basis: benchtop diagnostics/IT; spikes for imaging/sterilization if present

eclss.basis: OGA (~3.8–4.0 kW) + CO2 scrubber (~1.0 kW class) across two ISPRs (1.842 m² total). Peak ~OGA-only per ISPR.

stowage.basis: no active loads aside from local lighting

airlock.basis: sensors/lighting; pumps are event-based and should be modeled as equipment when used
